Generation VII.Sun: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
Generation VII.Moon: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It scatters its shining spores around itself. Even though they're dangerous, nighttime tours of forests where Morelull live are popular.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It likes damp dark places. When night falls, the spores filling the caps of its mushrooms glow.

Generation VIII.Sword: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull's head. The caps regrow overnight.
Generation VIII.Shield: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.

Generation VII.Sun: Route 11 , Brooklet Hill , Lush Jungle Night
Generation VII.Moon: Route 11 , Brooklet Hill , Lush Jungle Night

Generation VIII.Sword: Giant's Mirror , Hammerlocke Hills Rolling Fields , Dappled Grove , Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , Giant's Mirror , Hammerlocke Hills ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Giant's Mirror , Hammerlocke Hills Rolling Fields , Dappled Grove , Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , Giant's Mirror , Hammerlocke Hills ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Fields of Honor ( Max Raid Battle )
